alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Columbia and southeastern Greene Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 135 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milton, or near Catskill, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water. Locations impacted include... Hudson, Catskill, Claverack, Livingston, Copake, Athens, Philmont, Lorenz Park, Claverack-Red Mills, North-South Lake Campground, Germantown, Hillsdale, Taghkanic, Quarryville, Burden Dock, Manorville, Burden, Churchtown, Linlithgo Mills and North Hillsdale. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...and east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia; Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene
